Name: Add inline styles
Description: Can I add inline styles to an HTML element?

Chrome.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Styles** pane, click "element.style" to input the inline style.

Firefox.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Rules** pane, click "element​" to input the inline style.

Edge.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Styles** pane, click "element.style" to input the inline style.
Edge.References: 1. "Add a CSS declaration to an element", by Edge DevTools [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/devtools-guide-chromium/css/#add-a-css-declaration-to-an-element)

Safari.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Styles** pane, click inside "Style Attribute​" braces to input the inline style.

Opera.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Styles** pane, click "element.style" to input the inline style.

Polypane.Notes: 1. Inspect element > In the **Styles** pane, click "property" under "element.style" to input the inline style.
